summary: The document is a classified message pertaining to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, focusing on Vicente Herrero, a Cuban national with ties to anti-communist movements and media production in Cuba. It outlines Herrero's background, his affiliations with the Frente Anticomunista, and his involvement in media through a defunct magazine and a daily radio program. The document suggests an interest in leveraging Herrero's connections for local public opinion research and to support local activities, while underscoring the classified nature of the information and its restricted reproduction.
key_findings: The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It contains a request for information on Vicente Herrero, highlighting his Cuban nationality, family background, and involvement in media and anti-communist activities.
Herrero was associated with the Frente Anticomunista and involved in producing a now-defunct magazine and a daily radio program.
The message indicates an interest in using Herrero for local public opinion research and monitoring, as well as supporting local activities.
The document emphasizes the classified nature of the information and restricts its reproduction.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
